data.text:
@Ribas_VT @DavidSteadson Source data is here, if you want to check the numbers (they're correct). 1303 admissions of children and teenagers for covid during all of 2020 and 2021, and 1172 admissions reported in 2022 so far.
https://t.co/q14qTm8qp6
@Oxalix2 @HallgrenStefan @DavidSteadson And there are now four regions that dont report their hospitalisations. And there are also several hospitals not reporting anymore.
@Oxalix2 @HallgrenStefan @DavidSteadson Hahahaha you know they’ve stopped testing, right?
@HallgrenStefan @Tilda99390101 @DavidSteadson All available data suggest it's almost gone, nevertheless you insist on denying it. You sound like flat-earthers https://t.co/yP2QjiDcsH

@Oxalix2 @Tilda99390101 @DavidSteadson We can simply not know whether it's gone or not, since we restricted testing. 
Sewage water testing suggests it's declining, however infection rates remains high. We will know more at the end of the week regarding this week.
@HallgrenStefan @Tilda99390101 @DavidSteadson What i cannot see it's how you know it´s not gone

@Oxalix2 @Tilda99390101 @DavidSteadson You are basing this on the results from an test program that went from testing everyone to be limited to only test healthcare staff and ppl being admitted to hospitals? You Don't see the problem here?

@Oxalix2 @DavidSteadson You know, the virus evolves and finds its way to infect as many as possible. Adults are more likely to have had their third shot while kids maybe has had one or two. The virus strikes where it can. And kids under 12y in Sweden dont get the vaccine.
